utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What you guys don't understand is, for us, kissing is as important as any part of it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, right!.......Y'serious?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Everything you need to know is in that first kiss.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I think for us, kissing is pretty much like an opening act, y'know? I mean it's like the stand-up comedian you have to sit through before Pink Floyd comes out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, and-and it's not that we don't like the comedian, it's that-that... that's not why we bought the ticket.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The problem is, though, after the concert's over, no matter how great the show was, you girls are always looking for the comedian again, y'know? I mean, we're in the car, we're fighting traffic... basically just trying to stay awake.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, well, word of advice: Bring back the comedian. Otherwise next time you're gonna find yourself sitting at home, listening to that album alone.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ....Are we still talking about sex?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, it's good, it is good, it's just that- mm- doesn't she seem a little angry?

utterance.speaker: Marsha
utterance.content: Well, she has issues.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Does sheï¼Ÿ

utterance.speaker: Marsha
utterance.content: He's out banging other women over the head with a club, while she sits at home trying to get the mastodon smell out of the carpet!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Marsha, these are cave people. Okay? They have issues like 'Gee, that glacier's getting kinda close.' See?

utterance.speaker: Marsha
utterance.content: Speaking of issues, isn't that your ex-wife?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No. No.

utterance.speaker: Marsha
utterance.content: Yes, it is. Carol! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, okay, yes, it is. How about I'll, uh, catch up with you in the Ice Age.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: So.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You look great. I, uh... I hate that.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Sorry. You look good too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, well, in here, anyone who... stands erect... So what's new? Still, uh...

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: A lesbian?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well... you never know. How's, um.. how's the family?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Marty's still totally paranoid. Oh, and, uh-

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why- why are you here, Carol?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: I'm pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Pregnant?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I think this is the episode of Three's Company where there's some kind of misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you through with that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry, the swallowing slowed me down.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Whose little ball of paper is this?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, uh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, and then I realised I didn't need it, so I balled it up and... ...now I wish I was dead.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She's already fluffed that pillow... Monica, you know, you've already fluffed that- -but, it's fine!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look , I'm sorry, guys, I just don't wanna give them any more ammunition than they already have.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, and we all know how cruel a parent can be about the flatness of a child's pillow.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Monica- Hi! Um, Monica, you're scaring me. I mean, you're like, you're like all chaotic and twirly. And not-not in a good way.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, calm down. You don't see Ross getting all chaotic and twirly every time they come.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's because as far as my parents are concerned, Ross can do no wrong. Y'see, he's the Prince. Apparently they had some big ceremony before I was born.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ew, ew, ew, ew ew ew ew ew!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ugly Naked Guy got a Thighmaster!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Eeaagh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Has anybody seen my engagement ring?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, it's beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God, oh God, oh God oh God oh God oh God....

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, look, don't touch that!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, like I wasn't dreading tomorrow enough, having to give it back to him... 'Hi Barry! Remember me? I'm the girl in the veil who stomped on your heart in front of your entire family!' Oh God and now I'm gonna have to return the ring, without the ring, which makes it so much harder...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Easy Rach, we'll find it. Won't we!

utterance.speaker: Chandler and Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Alright, when'd'ya have it on last?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Doy! Probably right before she lost it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don't get a lot of 'doy' these days...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know I had it this morning, and I know I had it when I was in the kitchen with...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...Dinah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohhhhh, don't be mad...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You didn't.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I am sorry...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I gave you one job!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, but look how straight those noodles are!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now, Monica, you know that's not how you look for an engagement ring in a lasagne...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I just... can't do it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Boys? We're going in.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow. That is not a happy hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Carol's pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh! I found it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. Do that for another two hours, you might be where I am right about now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Kinda puts that whole pillow thing in perspective, huh, Mon?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well now, how-how do you fit into this whole thing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, Carol says she and Susan want me to be involved, but if I'm not comfortable with it, I don't have to be involved basically it's entirely up to me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She is so great! I miss her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What does she mean by 'involved'?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I mean presumably, the biggest part of your job is done.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Anyway, they want me to go down to this- sonogram thing with them tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So what are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I have no idea. No matter what I do, though, I'm still gonna be a father.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: .....Well, this is still ruined, right?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, Martha Ludwin's daughter is gonna call you. Mmm! What's that curry taste?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Curry.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Mmmm!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I- I think they're great! I, I really do.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Do you remember the Ludwins? The big one had a thing for you, didn't she?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: They all had a thing for him.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aw, Mom...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sorry, why is this girl going to call me?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, she just graduated, and she wants to be something in cooking, or food, or.... I don't know. Anyway, I told her you had a restaurant-

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No Mom, I don't have a restaurant, I work in a restaurant.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Well, they don't have to know that...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, could you come and help me with the spaghetti, please?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, we're having spaghetti! That's.... easy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know this is going to sound unbelievably selfish, but, were you planning on bringing up the whole baby/lesbian thing? Because I think it might take some of the heat off me.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: What that Rachel did to her life.... We ran into her parents at the club, they were not playing very well.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I'm not gonna tell you what they spent on that wedding... but forty thousand dollars is a lot of money!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Well, at least she had the chance to leave a man at the altar...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What's that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Nothing! It's an expression.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No it's not.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Don't listen to your mother. You're independent, and you always have been! Even when you were a kid... and you were chubby, and you had no friends, you were just fine! And you would read alone in your room, and your puzzles...

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Look, there are people like Ross who need to shoot for the stars, with his museum, and his papers getting published. Other people are satisfied with staying where they are- I'm telling you, these are the people who never get cancer.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: ...And I read about these women trying to have it all, and I thank God 'Our Little Harmonica' doesn't seem to have that problem.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, Ross, what's going on with you? Any stories? No news, no little anecdotes to share with the folks?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay! Okay. Look, I, uh- I realise you guys have been wondering what exactly happened between Carol and me, and, so, well, here's the deal. Carol's a lesbian. She's living with a woman named Susan. She's pregnant with my child, and she and Susan are going to raise the baby.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: And you knew about this?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Your folks are really that bad, huh?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, y'know, these people are pros. They know what they're doing, they take their time, they get the job done.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Boy, I know they say you can't change your parents,... boy, if you could- -I'd want yours.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Must pee.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y'know, it's even worse when you're twins.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You're twins?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. We don't speak. She's like this high-powered, driven career type.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What does she do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She's a waitress.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, you guys, I kinda gotta clean up now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, you're an only child, right? You don't have any of this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, no, although I did have an imaginary friend, who... my parents actually preferred.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The lights, please..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...How long was I in there?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm just cleaning up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: D'ya.. uh.. Do you need any help?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh.. okay, sure! Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Anyway.. um.. So, you- uh- you nervous about Barry tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.. a little..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mm-hmm..

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: A lot.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, got any advice? Y'know, as someone who's recently been- dumped?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, you may wanna steer clear of the word 'dumped'. Chances are he's gonna be this, this broken shell of a man, y'know, so you should try not to look too terrific, I know it'll be hard. Or, y'know, uh, hey!, I'll go down there, and I'll give Barry back his ring, and you can go with Carol and Susan to the OB/GYN...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you've got Carol tomorrow.. When did it get so complicated?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Got me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Remember when we were in high school together?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean, didn't you think you were just gonna meet somone, fall in love- and that'd be it? ..Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, yes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Man, I never thought I'd be here..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Me either...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sorry I'm late, I was stuck at work. There was this big dinosaur.. thing.. anyway.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ross, you remember Susan.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How could I forget?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello, Susan. Good shake. Good shake. So, uh, we're just waiting for...?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Dr. Oberman.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ..Dr. Oberman. Okay. And is he-

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: She.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: -she, of course, she- uh- familiar with our.. special situation?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Yes, and she's very supportive.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, that's great. No, I'm- Oh.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Quack, quack..

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ross? That opens my cervix.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Barry?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Yeah! It's fine, it's fine. Robbie's gonna be here for hours.

utterance.speaker: Robbie
utterance.content: Huh?!

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: So, how ya doin?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm- uh- I'm okay... You look great!

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Yeah, well..

utterance.speaker: Bernice
utterance.content: Dr. Farber, Jason Greenstein's gagging.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Be right there. Be back in a sec.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I dumped him.

utterance.speaker: Robbie
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, um- so how's this, uh, how's this gonna work? Y'know, with us? Y'know, when, like, important decisions have to be made?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Give me a 'for instance'.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, uh, uh, I don't know, okay, okay, how about with the, uh, with the baby's name?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Marlon-

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Marlon?!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: -if it's a boy, Minnie if it's a girl.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...As in Mouse?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: As in my grandmother.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Still, you- you say Minnie, you hear Mouse. Um, how about, um.. how about Julia?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Julia..

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: We agreed on Minnie.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: 'S'funny, um, uh, we agreed we'd spend the rest of our lives together. Things change, roll with the punches. I believe Julia's on the table..?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Sorry about that. So. What have you been up to?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, not much. I-I got a job.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Oh, that's great.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why are- why are you so tanned?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Oh, I, uh- I went to Aruba.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no. You went on our honeymoon alone?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: No. I went with, uh.. Now, this may hurt.

utterance.speaker: Robbie
utterance.content: Me?!

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: No! I went with Mindy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mindy?! My maid of honour, Mindy?!

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Yeah, well, uh, we're kind of a thing now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Well, um.. You've got plugs!

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Careful! They haven't quite taken yet.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And you've got lenses! But you hate sticking your finger in your eye!

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Not for her. Listen, I really wanted to thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay..

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: See, about a month ago, I wanted to hurt you. More than I've ever wanted to hurt anyone in my life. And I'm an orthodontist.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: You know, you were right? I mean, I thought we were happy. We weren't happy. But with Mindy, now I'm happy. Spit.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Robbie
utterance.content: Me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Anyway, um, I guess this belongs to you. And thank you for giving it to me.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Well, thank you for giving it back.

utterance.speaker: Robbie
utterance.content: Hello?!

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, please! What's wrong with Helen?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Helen Geller? I don't think so.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Hello? It's not gonna be Helen Geller.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: No, I mean it's not Geller.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, it's gonna be Helen Willick?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: No, actually, um, we talked about Helen Willick-Bunch.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, wait a minute, wha- why is she in the title?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: It's my baby too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, 's'funny, really? Um, I don't remember you making any sperm.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Yeah, and we all know what a challenge that is!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: All right, you two, stop it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No no no, she gets a credit, hey, I'm in there too.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ross. You're not actually suggesting Helen Willick-Bunch-Geller? 'Cause I think that borders on child abuse.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of course not, I'm... suggesting Geller-Willick-Bunch.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, no, nonononono, you see what he's doing? He knows no-one's gonna say all those names, so they'll wind up calling her Geller, then he gets his way!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My way?! You-you think this is my way? Believe me, of all the ways I ever imagined this moment in my life being, this is not my way- y'know what? Uh, um, this is too hard. I'm not, I can't do-

utterance.speaker: Dr. Oberman
utterance.content: Knock knock!How are we today? Any nausea?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. A little.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Oberman
utterance.content: Well, I was just wondering about the mother-to-be, but.. thanks for sharing. Uh, lie back..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You- uh- y'know what, I'm gonna go. I don't- I don't think I can be involved in this particular thing right now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Look at that.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well? Isn't that amazing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are we supposed to be seeing here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I donâ€™t know, but.. I think it's about to attack the Enterprise.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You know, if you tilt your head to the left, and relax your eyes, it kinda looks like an old potato.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Then don't do that, alright?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wh- are you welling up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You are, you're welling up.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Am not!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're gonna be an aunt.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh shut up!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, Mindy. Hi, it-it's Rachel. Yeah, I'm fine. I-I saw Barry today. Oh, yeah, yeah he-he told me. No, no, it's okay. I hope you two are very happy, I really do. Oh, oh, and Mind, y'know, if-if everything works out, and you guys end up getting married and having kids- and everything- I just hope they have his old hairline and your old nose. Okay, I know it was a cheap shot, but I feel so much better now.
